1.2 Create Internet Gateway and NAT Gateway

Theoretically, all your public subnet's Internet traffic should be sent out through a Internet Gateway. At this step, we will create a Internet Gateway for future usage.

After the creation of the VCN, you should be in the VCN detail page, select Internet Gateway on the left.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/internet_gw_menu.png}}
Within Internet Gateways tab, click on "Create Internet Gateway".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/create_internet_gateway_button.png}}

Name your Internet Gateway, the compartment should be the same one with your VCN. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/internet_gateway_config.png}}</br>Click on Create Internet Gateway button at the bottom and finish.
Similar to public subnet, all your private subnet's Internet traffic should be sent out through an NAT Gateway. At this step, we will create an NAT Gateway for future usage.

Same as Internet Gateway, select NAT Gateway on the left.
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/nat_gw_menu.png}}
Within NAT Gateways tab, click on "Create NAT Gateway".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/create_nat_gateway_button.png}}

Name your NAT Gateway, the compartment should be the same one with your VCN. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/nat_gateway_config.png}}</br>Click on Create NAT Gateway button at the bottom and finish.
